Module ca.utoronto.utm.assignment2
Package ca.utoronto.utm.assignment2.paint

Class ModeStrategyFactory

java.lang.Object
ca.utoronto.utm.assignment2.paint.ModeStrategyFactory
public class ModeStrategyFactory extends Object
Factory class for creating instances of different ModeStrategy implementations.

This class provides a static method to obtain the appropriate strategy for a given mode in the painting application. The strategies determine how the application responds to mouse events based on the current mode, such as drawing, selecting, or erasing objects.

See Also:
  • ModeStrategy
  • SelectModeStrategy
  • ObjectEraserStrategy
  • PolylineModeStrategy
  • TextModeStrategy
  • DrawModeStrategy

  • Method Details

    • getModeStrategy

      public static ModeStrategy getModeStrategy(String mode, PaintModel model, PropertiesPanel pp, javafx.scene.layout.Pane canvasPane)
      Returns an instance of the ModeStrategy based on the given mode.

      The method selects the correct strategy based on the current mode (e.g., "Select", "Polyline", "ObjectEraser", "text"). It initializes the strategy with the necessary parameters, including the current paint model, properties panel, and canvas pane.

      Parameters:
      mode - The current mode of interaction, determining which strategy to use (e.g., "Select", "Polyline").
      model - The paint model that holds the current state of the drawing.
      pp - The properties panel that manages paint properties like colors and brush settings.
      canvasPane - The canvas pane where shapes are drawn, used for text mode.
      Returns:
      A ModeStrategy instance that handles the specified mode.
